7.19.24  9:52 pm   have you ever made an intentionally terrible song because you were bored

Â Â Â Â Â  that wouldn't be the reason i'd make a terrible song. the reason for trying to make a terrible song would be if for some reason trying to make a good song isn't working. sometimes in those situations if you try to make a terrible song, it's more fun and it often backfires and turns out good

7.19.24  9:23 pm   what does your music taste like

Â Â Â Â Â  i'm not sure

7.19.24  5:43 pm   Is there a logic behind the color scheme in the titles on this website ? can we find it ?

Â Â Â Â Â  not logic, but an aesthetic. which in most cases you can find by looking at it

7.19.24  5:14 pm   Why do people have such a hard time understanding that not all songs are autobiographical?

Â Â Â Â Â  maybe all of their own songs are autobiographical. or, similarly, maybe none of their own songs are not autobiographical

Â Â Â Â Â  that's mostly just to maintain a clear indication that the video page is not complete

7.19.24  3:12 pm   how did you find the land of two letter words? i've been searching for quite a while

Â Â Â Â Â  if you just take a fairly large body of text, you should be able to find a good amount of 2-letter words. then just start using only those words. probably will be hard to make good syntactical sense, but what are you gonna do

Â Â Â Â Â  insane

Â Â Â Â Â  more assumptions than a question, but the assumptions are wrong. if i ever did any persona switching, it would have nothing to do with the contexts you mentioned

7.18.24  4:50 pm   After listening to it countless times, I know exactly what the piano is going to do in "time mop" after zero. But it still gives me a real buzz. How and why?

Â Â Â Â Â  i think it's 3 things - the reverb, the little bit of distortion, but most importantly it's not quantized, so you can hear me losing my mind intimately while playing it
